metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29385 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNOME gdk-pixbuf (aka GdkPixbuf) before 2.42.2 allows a denial of service (infinite loop) in lzw.c in the function write_indexes. if c->self_code equals 10, self->code_table[10].extends will assign the value 11 to c. The next execution in the loop will assign self->code_table[11].extends to c, which will give the value of 10. This will make the loop run infinitely. This bug can, for example, be triggered by calling this function with a GIF image with LZW compression that is crafted in a special way.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gdkpixbuf-2.0 - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-bin - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-common - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream bug, gdk-pixbuf < 2.39.2 is not vulnerable

criterions.comment: gdk-pixbuf package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1').
